title: Firefox freezing after latest Windows 10 update
content: After last nights Windows 10 update, Firefox freezes whenever it tries to load. At first, I would have to try loading two or three times before it would actually load my home page. First try - Invalid applilcation, cannot load. Second try - loads Firefox with a blank home page, no searching; all bookmarks are inactive; only show "new tab". Third try - Firefox loaded BUT all Bookmark Folders have disappeared!!! Since then nothing is working even after updating it twice. I am still only getting a blank home page with none of the listed bookmarks being active. Each effort seems to bring about less and less function. Google browser is working fine, but I'm not found of that one - only use it as a backup.

title: How to remove address bar suggestions that are off the page & not showing?

This used to work but stopped. I could enter a single letter & use the down arrow key to view every suggestion that started with that letter. And delete items no longer needed. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1410871

How can I view or scroll through all suggestions related to a search term? Thanks

title: Firefox Opens to Blank Page
content:
I am running Firefox-112.0(64bit) on Debian Bullseye. When I pend Firefox I am presented with a blank page rather that my normal sign in page.

Opening a terminal window and starting Firefox with /opt/firefox/firefox generates the following errors:

comp@AbNormal:~$ /opt/firefox/firefox [GFX1-]: glxtest: VA-API test failed: no supported VAAPI profile found. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. ATTENTION: default value of option mesa_glthread overridden by environment. [ERROR glean_core] Error setting metrics feature config: Json(Error("EOF while parsing a value", line: 1, column: 0))

If I enter a URL the page opens and is usable.

How can this problem be fixed?

Thanks in advance.

title: Can't add buttons for addons to the menu-bar
content:
I feel stupid but I can't find a way to add buttons for single addons to the menu-bar on top. I know in the past this was possible but now I have to click the button for "extentions" and there all addons can be found (see first screenshot). I would rather have buttons for single addons available in the menu-bar, for example for my ad-blocker. I tried "customize" but there the addons don't show up for some reason (see second screenshot - sorry that it's in german). I am not browsing in private mode in case you're wondering.

Edit: Okay nvm, I figured it out already. I didn't know I had to right-click the addons while in the extension-menu. I still find it kind of weird that the addons don't show up in the customize-view anymore.

title: Notevole utilizzo di CPU e Memoria
content: Gentili Sig.ri, da un po di tempo Firefox non è piu fluido nel suo utilizzo. Subito dopo aver acceso il computer con sistema operativo Windows 10 ed aver lanciato firefox, parte la ventola di raffreddamento del computer, GESTIONE ATTIVITA di windows mostra utilizzo da parte di firefox del 100% di CPU e memoria. Ho provato a seguire qualche suggerimento gia disponibile sul vostro sito ma ce ne sono tanti difficile seguire tutto. L'unica manovra, tra quelle provate, che mi fa uscire da questa condizione e' attivare la modalità risoluzione problemi dal menu aiuto. Non ho componenti aggiuntivi che possano creare problemi. Resto in attea di un cortese riscontro. Grazie Felice
creator: felix.fdc

title: Why is Firefox blocking Google?
content: Firefox is not intentionally blocking Google, but rather is responding to certain security protocols that can interfere with the functionality of webpages. Google uses a secure connection (SSL/TLS) to encrypt the data sent between its servers and the user's browser. If Firefox detects a problem in vehicle wrap pricing calculator vehicle wrap pricing calculator with the secure connection, it may block the website from loading. This could be caused by a misconfigured security setting, an outdated or corrupt browser, or a conflict with an installed add-on or extension. To resolve the issue, users should check their security settings and ensure their browser is up-to-date, as well as disabling any unnecessary add-ons or extensions.
